name: Parkwood at Marble Arch

reviews.text: Was really easy to find the B&B especially because I had never been to London before. Great Location, could not believe it, opposite Hyde Park, around the corner from Marble Arch and a 5 minute walk to Oxford Street and the street it was in was very classy and up market.
reviews.title: Nice B&B, GREAT LOCATION!!!

likes.disliked: — Decor was dated could have done with a bit of TLC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parkwood Hotel (although it is a bed and breakfast) was nice, the staff were very friendly and helpful, our room was ok, a little dated but as it was only going to be somewhere to sleep at night it wasnt a problem, the bathroom was clean, with power shower which was nice in the mornings and we also had frreeview on the television. The breakfast was nice, with the usual on offer.
reviews.title: Good if you are on a budget

reviews.text: There is no lift so either pack light or ensure to bring your muscles to carry your luggage as it is over 3 floors, we were on the ground floor so only had to go down one set of stairs which was not too bad and their was only one room down their for guests and the owners so it was fairly quite.
reviews.title: Room 6
Good location
reviews.text: Nice for a short weekend stay on a budget.

My husband and I were on a budget so we selected the Parkwood based on favorable reviews. For what it was, it was a good choice for us. Great location, close to the tube (Marble Arch) and Hyde Park. It was located on a little side street so noise was not an issue.
reviews.title: Location, location and free wifi

likes.disliked: — Rooms a bit small, room decor a little tired.

reviews.text: we stayed in the parkwood hotel for 6 nights in august and found it to be a good, basic and comfortable hotel and very good value for money, especially for people who are on a budget.the staff were very friendly and the breakfast that we had each morning was lovely and it wasnt too much bother if we wanted more to eat either as they were more than happy to oblige!a good central location near to hyde park and for the tube station as well.not far from the busy shopping area of oxford street too!hotel is located in a quiet side street so we had a very peaceful stay and would probably stay there again!
reviews.title: a great budget hotel!

reviews.text: What a pleasure to find a small hotel at a reasonable price and in a great location in London! We enjoyed our three nights here and definitely recommend this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and the "ambiance" made us feel at home right away. The rooms and beds were very comfortable and clean. The breakfast room was bright and we were offered a full English breakfast each morning which set us up for the day! The hotel is tucked away in a pleasant street just across from Hyde park and very close to busy Oxford Street, but we found the hotel quiet and a good place to return to after a day of exploring London!
reviews.title: A great small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after the Gershwin in NY for 5 nights. Our room was on the ground floor at the back, so it was quiet and had access to outside sitting area.
reviews.title: Handy location, worth the $

likes.liked: — Location, breakfast & staff, gound floor room

reviews.title: Great B&B on a budhet
reviews.text: The room was small but fine. Sep toilet, and sep shower which was tiny but worked fine.
Location, price and the breakfast are the best things about this hotel. The staff are pleasant and friendly and helpfull with directions etc.
reviews.title: Parkwood Hotel - Incredible Stay!

likes.disliked: — 80 stairs up to the top room - but still worth the trip

reviews.text: The Parkwood is an excellent choice for people who don't need a 5-star hotel experience, but still expect a clean, safe hotel in London.
reviews.title: Just what I wanted

reviews.text: Location -- just off the northwest corner of Hyde Park, easy to get to, and on a very nice, quiet side street.
reviews.title: A hidden gem!

reviews.text: Cleanliness -- No issues. Probably a 4 out of 5 on this one.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

likes.liked: — It's a three-way tie between the cosy rooms, friendly service and terrific location!

reviews.text: Friendliness -- I said a grand total of about 15 words to the staff in my 3 days here...and most of those were to the nice cook downstairs as I was getting my delicious breakfast. They left me alone otherwise (which is just how I like it).
reviews.title: lovin london

reviews.text: Rooms are small, but fine for one person (had to use the bed as a desk for my laptop). No elevator/lift, which was fine for me, as I was just one floor up. Breakfasts are good (7:30 to 9), wi-fi is excellent, and value ($150/night) was as good as you'll find.
reviews.title: very nice stay

likes.liked: — clean room, very good English breakfasts

reviews.title: Cosy and cheap
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in August 2008 for four nights. It is in a fantastic location, across from hyde park and a nice easy walk to the Marble Arch tube station. The breakfast is fantastic - you can ask for white or wholemeal toast, eggs the way you like them, bacon, sausages, baked beans etc.. The room was very small for us 2, but as we understand it, this was not unusual for a London lodging. The bathroom was poorly put together (a DIY job) but did the trick. We had trouble with receiving reception on our television but could get a few channels. Overall we would stay there again because of the location, breakfast and value for money!

likes.disliked: — Nowhere to put your belongings in the petite room

reviews.text: I stayed at the Parkwood Hotel for two nights as it enjoys a central London location and was fairly close to the Royal Albert Hall, where I was to attend a show. The Parkwood is a fabulous budget hotel offering good value for money with the added benefit of a hearty breakfast and friendly staff.
reviews.title: One of the BEST budget hotels in London!

reviews.text: If you are expecting a modern hotel offering up-to-date facilities, you will be disappointed. For example, there is no lift (clearly stated on website), so be prepared to carry heavy suitcases up flights of stairs. To avoid this inconvenience (especially if elderly or disabled), I would advise that you request a room on the first or second floors. There are no separate recreation rooms in the hotel for guests, but the main reception room includes a comfortable lounge area with sofas and plenty of magazines. The breakfast room is situated on the lower basement floor and is only open in the mornings. I should mention that the Parkwood includes an outside balcony at the rear of the property, with table and chairs. This area is particularly convenient for smokers and an ashtray is provided.
reviews.title: Parkwood Hotel, a Charming Experience

reviews.text: If you are expecting splendour and luxury, you will be disappointed. The decor is looking somewhat tired and some of the DIY improvement is quite amateur, especially the sealant applied around shower cubicles and sinks etc. The rooms are not particularly spacious or grand, but they are adequate. The rooms have basic tea and coffee making facilities and a small television for entertainment. Importantly, you will find the Parkwood a clean hotel - a very important factor to consider when you are searching for budget accommodation. You will enjoy the very least any guest should expect - clean, fresh sheets on your bed and no creepy-crawlies (cockroaches) or rodents sharing your room!
reviews.title: Good on a budget

likes.liked: — The location, price, breakfast, friendly staff

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: You are also treated to a splendid breakfast (included in the room price), one of the best I have had from a budget hotel as usually you only get a basic continental breakfast. At the Parkwood, you get a choice of fruit juice, followed by an excellent selection of cereal, tea or coffee, full English breakfast and brown and white toast with assortment of preserves. If you are still hungry you need only ask for more - but I doubt anyone would not be completely satisfied.

description: Best of UK - BedandBreakfast.com Award Winner, 2009-2010! The Parkwood occupies one of the best locations for a good-value hotel in London - near Oxford Street and Marble Arch on a fairly quiet street, just 50 yards from Hyde Park, in a section of London known as Connaught Village. "Frommers"
